answers.author: Barry Crook
answers.text:
We have a "shared savings" program whereby any money not spent against budget at the end of the year is allocated: (1) 40% is returned to the departments in a "savings" line item -- they can use it for capital needs and unanticipated needs during the year as authorized by the city manager, (2) 10% is returned to a 'central savings' account under the direction of the city manager and (3) the rest -- 50% is returned to fund balance.

author: Jeff Calentine
text: Does anyone have a program in place that incentivizes their departments to be more fiscally conservative with their budgets? We are fairly restricted by state statutes in what we can do, but I was looking for some creative ideas to encourage our Department Heads to save money. Thanks!
title: Cost Savings Benefit Program
